description: Number of non-cyclic hydrocarbons with n carbon atoms.
references: N. J. A. Sloane and Simon Plouffe, The Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1995 (includes this sequence).
links: R. C. Read, Some recent results in chemical enumeration, Lect. Notes Math. 303 (1972), 243-259.
example: a(3) = 4 because there are 4 non-cyclic structures that can be drawn with 3 carbons (propane, propene, propyne, and allene). - _David Consiglio, Jr._, May 15 2014
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Apr 30 1991
extensions: a(11) (computed using Nauty) from Vesa Linja-aho (vesa.linja-aho(AT)tkk.fi), Apr 24 2008
a(12)-a(13) (computed using Molgen 3.5) from _David Consiglio, Jr._, May 15 2014
Existing terms verified and a(14)-a(16) from _Sean A. Irvine_, Dec 22 2014
a(18)-a(19) corrected and a(20)-a(24) (computed using nauty) from _Sean A. Irvine_, Jan 02 2015
